headline: Better than Best Fried Chicken
description: This chicken fried with cornstarch is first dipped in a condensed soup batter, then fried until crispy and juicy for better-than-ever fried chicken.

video.description: Discover the secret ingredient that makes this fried chicken the best.
video.name: Better Than Best Fried Chicken

name: Better than Best Fried Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine condensed soup, egg, and seasoning salt (be careful, as soup is already salted) in a shallow dish or bowl; mix well. Dip chicken in mixture and turn to coat completely. Set aside.

Mix together flour, cornstarch, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper in a resealable plastic bag. Place chicken pieces, one at a time, in the bag, seal and shake to coat. Add more flour and cornstarch as necessary, but add them in equal parts.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Be sure to use enough oil to cover chicken pieces.

Place coated chicken on a platter; allow to sit until outside becomes doughy (this is critical to ensure crispiness when fried). Once chicken coating is doughy, test oil by dropping a piece of coating into it; oil is ready if it starts to fry immediately.
Working in batches, fry chicken pieces in hot oil until cooked through and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve.

review.reviewBody: Excellent, with the addition of extra seasoning. (I followed the advice of another reviewer, and used the "Chicken seasoning blend" recipe on this site.) One reviewer made a remark about using "chemical-laden cream of chicken soup", which sent me on a mission to find out just what chemicals Campbell's cream of chicken soup is "laden" with: CHICKEN BROTH (WATER, CHICKEN STOCK), MODIFIED CORN STARCH, CHICKEN FAT, SEASONED CHICKEN, VEGETABLE OIL (CORN, CANOLA AND OR SOYBEAN), WHEAT FLOUR, SALT, CREAM, YEAST EXTRACT, MODIFIED MILK INGREDIENTS, SOY PROTEIN CONCENTRATE, ONION POWDER, VINEGAR, BETA CAROTENE, FLAVOUR (CONTAINS CELERY). Beta carotene is a naturally-occuring pigment found in yellow & orange fruits and vegetables. It is an antioxidant, which your body turns to vitamin A, in the quantities it needs. Next I'll try oven-cooking this in my cast iron skillet, as another reviewer suggests.

Really good crunch! I had to add some seasoning to the flour mixture too or lightly sprinkle with salt after frying but I didn’t have cream of mushroom soup, so I used cream of celery and I’m really glad I found this recipie!

My girlfriend does not fry foods because of the grease splatter. SMH. I decided to use this recipe and fry in a medium pot to reduce the splatter and show her, frying wasn't that difficult. I followed some of the reviews about the seasonings. I decided to use the Chicken Blend recipe found on this site. I was amazed by the results. My GF was astonished how easy and how delicious the fried chicken was. I can't wait to try this recipe for my family. Thank you for sharing! My go-to going forward.
It was the worst chicken recipe ever. Messy, the coating does not stick in the fryer and it doesn't really taste good. Never again.

This was a good and taste way to fry chicken. However, I kept waiting for it to get browner while it fried. It didn't. But it was done. Just keep in mind that it's not as dark brown as other fried chicken recipes. At least, this was my experience.
I liked it, but I will use chicken thighs in lieu of breasts
The recipe itself isn't bad i just think i didn't it bread it good enough. Mine barely has breading.

The best way to add flavor to chicken is to begin seasoning it several hours before you cook it. Just ask Paula Deen. You don't have to make a wet brine, just sprinkle salt and seasoning on the chicken and give it a rub. In an hour, the chicken will drop juice, and when you come back a couple of hours later, the juice will be gone, having been sucked back into the chicken, along with the flavors of the seasonings you used. For those who like spicy chicken, I suggest using a dry spice (cayenne, ground chipotle, hot paprika, Szeshuan, whatever you like or have on hand). That way you're not diluting the dunk with another liquid. I also prefer bread flour to AP flour, as the extra protein packs a bit more crunch. To make those craggy, crunchy bits on your chicken, pour some of the dunk mixture into your flour and work it well with your fingers. You will notice that the flour will form lumps (flat craggy bits), that will stick to the chicken and give you a craggier, less smooth fried chicken. Craggy = Crunchy.
Yummy.
Pretty awesome recipe. Needs little more spices. Other than that kudo's to the owner

I seasoned my chicken with a little olive oil and salt, pepper and garlic and McCormick Montreal Chicken Seasoning before dredging in soup and flour. The chicken was very moist on the inside. I like the outside too but probably should have let it get a little crispier. I loved the way it tasted and it reheated the next day wonderfully.
very crunchy and yummy! my husband loved it, and it was the first time using my deep fryer! thanks!

Came out great, I keep searching for the perfect fried chicken recipe.This is the best recipe, so far, for the taste I am lookin for. Only suggestion I have, is coming up with a substitute for the chemical laden canned cream of chicken soup
Cooked as is. Yes will make again.
Awesome recipe! Whoever came up with this, Thanks! Yummy!!!!!
I've made it twice now, and except that it's a bit messy to do, I am going to make mine this way from now on. I used a zero calorie, zero fat, zero chloresterol buttery spray.
It was good. I would make it again

I love this recipe and so does my family! I have used it for chicken and pork chops, by switching from cream of chicken to cream of mushroom soup. I also added an equal portion of crushed pretzels, for extra crunch.
There were no changes. It was the best-fried chicken ever! Thanks for the recipe.

This was great! As is, my picky husband thought it was great. I was really intimidated to make fried chicken - having never made it before - but was myself pleased with the turn out. I did buy a special oil thermometer to make sure I had the oil at the right temp and I think that was helpful. My one critique is that it was almost kind of bland. I am making it again this weekend and will use more seasoning. I will probably also be using up my cream of chicken with herbs, so maybe that will add a new flavor.

My third attempt ever at making fried chicken and it was a success, finally! This was such a simple recipe and turned out great. The only change I made was that I used gluten free flour because 3 of the 6 of us in my family cannot eat wheat/gluten. Only thing I may change is to add more salt and seasonings next time. Will definitely make this again- it was so moist inside and golden on the outside and only took 7 minutes to fry. The family loved it. Thank you for a great recipe!
These were great. Made strips but added crushed generic corn flakes. It was a hit with my teenage son and his friend. Will make these again.
I just made this, this morning and I have to say It's quite a bit messy in preparing it. But. it was very good.

This was excellent! I didn't have any cornstarch so I threw in some Wondra and some season salt, basil, garlic salt and powder, cayenne pepper and some other stuff I forgot now. lol I let it let sit for about an hour and put in the deep fryer for 10-13 minutes. seriously the best fried chicken I have ever made. thank you!!! :)
This recipe is DA BOMB! I used wings and Wow what flavor is delivered from the cream of mushroom soup. It's a winner.
YUMMY N EASY TO MAKE
No changes, no will never make again.

Having made this recipe twice, this is the go to recipe my husband ask for. We have enjoyed it both times. The only change I made was by accident, not having enough time to finish the cooking at one time. I began with using chicken breast cut into strips. Placed the strips in the soug/egg mixture and placed in the refrigerator until I had more time to work with it. They turned out great, really moist and loved the batter. Great recipe.
No major changes. Just instead of salt I used Adobe all purpose seasoning and italian seasoning. It was really great!

Good recipe. I added hot sauce to the soup mixture; oregano and poultry seasoning to the flour.
3/28/2017
This is delicious!

Excellent recipe. I actually mixed all the ingredients (wet and dry) together to make a batter and let it sit for a few minutes to get thick. I rolled the drumsticks around in the batter and then dusted them with panko crumbs. Best fried chicken I have ever had.
I used cream of mushroom soup and it was excellent!
best chicken wings ever ,crispy out side moist inside .

Delicious! The chicken was moist and crispy. Following the advice of other reviews, I added extra seasoning, garlic and onion powder, salt, pepper, season salt and poultry seasoning, and yet it still could have used a little more seasoning. I also used buttermilk with the egg and soup mixture. I also added the above spices in both the wet and dry mixture. My advice is to use a heavy hand when seasoning your chicken. This recipe will definitely go into the family rotation.
Absolutely loved it! Did however take heed to use more seasonings. Good call!
I used this recipe for the second time a few nights ago to rave reviews.

I got the family sized can of soup and added two eggs. Doubled the flour/cornstartch/etc mixture to make sure I had enough. This was amazing! I have tried a few other fried chicken recipes and they never turned out. This was delicious!

I loved it! I've tried many other fried chicken recipes & this one is my FAVORITE! My family seems to agree with me too. I doubled the recipe & used it on chicken legs & it was DELICIOUS! Just the right amount of seasoning & so flavorful. Definitely worth a try, you'll LOVE it too & so easy to make, enjoy! :-)
The family enjoyed this recipe. I used "Slap yo Mama" seasoning directly on the chicken and in the flour/cornstarch mixture. Simply awesome!!!

While quite a messy recipe (lots to clean up after, especially when the flour and cornstarch decide to wander) it is well worth the effort. This was my first foray into fried chicken (usually my dad does it) and this turned out WONDERFULLY! Nice crisp breading and moist, tender chicken. I did do one small change, I had 4 breasts so I sliced them into three strips each to make "tenders". The listed amount of coating and breading worked out perfectly for the twelve tenders!

Best fried chicken I ever made!!! My family loves it so much that we stop buying fried chicken from Churches. It's simple, crunchy on the outside, tender in the inside and fast. I cook mine in a deep fryer. Great recipe, thanks!!
Amazing on chicken legs and thighs. Crispy and delicious. But I find the batter didn't stick well when using skinless chicken breasts.

I consider myself an above average cook, but crispy fried chicken with crust that didn't fall off during frying was my Achille's heel until this recipe. I saw cream of chicken soup and cornstarch and thought this must be some kind of crazy messed up recipe. Then I read the reviews and no real mention of the soup or corn starch not working so I made this almost exactly as written except I used chicken legs and doubled the recipe to accommodate the amount I was making. Per other reviewers, I upped the amount of spice. I was so pleased with the outcome I nearly cried. After years of failure I can make good fried chicken! Hallelujah!
Delicious. Made it with chicken breast and did not use shortening but just regular oil and butter. Used garlic powder instead of garlic and put some in the gravy.
My favorite way to fix fried chicken.
This was unbelievably good. Try this I really think you'll like it. I browned lightly and finished it in the oven.

I made this recipe and doubled the seasonings measurements due to all the comments that it was bland. I also added adobo seasoning. Before I coated the chicken with the egg and soup mixture, I lightly coated the chicken with flour so the coating would stick better and then placed the chicken in the bag with the seasonings and flour mixture. Everyone loved it and I will definitely make it again

I have to say I was skeptical of this recipe, and it was a bit messy and there was a learning curve, but we loved the chicken! Like many I added a lot more spices to my mix, we like a spicy fried chicken with lots of flavor, and I partially boiled my chicken in heavily salted water (your chicken gets done all the way and the meat gets seasoned as well!). Other than that made it exactly as directed! It was super crunchy and absolutely picture perfect.
Delicious!! My picky kids loved it!!!! Will definitely do it again and again.
Very good I recommend using oregano and parsley. My family loved it too. I've already made it twice.
I followed the recipe but also added Lawry's Seasoning Salt. In addition, using cornstarch added a nice crunch.

Wow! This chicken was better than the best. Crispy outside and still nice and juicy inside. Awesome! 
 I used 20 chicken tenders. One can of the Cream of Chicken Soup worked well. I do not add salt to anything. I did have one change. I used Mrs. Dash Garlic and Herb along with all the other spices. This made 3 batches of yummy goodness. The last batch I sprinkled a dusting of cayenne pepper over prior to frying. Every batch was delicious. The photo I added really shows the crispiness. I will experiment with different soups and maybe even Ranch dressing next time.
I love this recipe. I could never make a decent fried chicken. Then I found this recipe and I just love it. Comes out perfect every time. I make this every week. Great recipe
We use chicken breasts and turn this recipe into chicken fingers. This is absolutely delicious! A regular menu item in our home.

This was really good! I soaked the chicken overnight because I didn't read the recip until right before I wanted to cook it. So I did all the prep work the night before and cooked it the next night. I just used two breasts because that's what I had. I still had enough leftovers for later after two people ate. My husband doesn't care for garlic, but didn't notice the garlic in this.

I think this was one of my best attempts at fried chicken. I used about 2T 'Better than Bullion', in place of the cream of chicken soup, along with some milk, and increased the amount of the spices. I double dipped/battered the chicken tenders and fried until they were a deep, golden brown. I also made sure to keep my oil hot and to space out my batches, so the oil didn't cool too much. It was very crunchy and delicious this way.

I think this was one of my best attempts at fried chicken. I used about 2T 'Better than Bullion', in place of the cream of chicken soup, along with some milk, and increased the amount of the spices. I double dipped/battered the chicken tenders and fried until they were a deep, golden brown. I also made sure to keep my oil hot and to space out my batches, so the oil didn't cool too much. It was very crunchy and delicious this way.
Great recipe easy to follow. I added some Louisiana Seasoning to it for a little kick, but it was flavorful as is
This was amazeballs! Easy & delish! I added an extra dash of paprika, that's it. Crispy,moist~NomNomNom!
quite bland
Very bland. also the recipe recipe should state to cook the dark meat longer.

I really liked this recipe. It gave boneless,skinless chicken breast flavor and that crunch without skin. I did use more seasoning and I did rest it awhile in the fridge and then again after putting the flour/cornstarch coating on. Next time I think I'll marinate in Buttermilk too.

I don't think it lived up to its name. We tend to like more flavor then what this had. It did come out nice and crispy just needs more favor. I'll definitely try it again but will add more spices to see if we get 
better results.

This is why I love Allrecipes!! What a wonderful recipe! Who new dipping your chicken in cream of chicken soup would give the chicken so much flavor! WOW!!! I am pretty impressed... My chicken was not bland at all!after coating my chicken in the seasoned flour i set it in the fridge for 30 min took it out and re coated it with flour again! it was super crispy!
It could use a lot more seasoning in my opinion.
Af
I love this chicken and I made it like 5x now :)

awe this was awesome nice flavor with some extra spices of your liken I have made this three times now and each time there's been no left overs 1st time I followed the original recipe. very good But I felt needed more flavor.. second time i followed TSLITOR One of the reviewers and it was really good so there is alot you can do with your favorit soup mixture and chicken Thanks for sharing !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This made crispy, flavorful, juicy chicken. I added some seasonings like others mentioned in previous reviews. Will definitely make again!!!!

Wow! Extra seasoning is a must and I should have doubled the flour mixture, but this is IT!! Try adding some onion and chili powder too. I can't keep the fam out of the kitchen lol Thanks so much for this recipe!

I loved that this recipe had ingredients easy to get, was simple to follow, and was very specific on what to one had to look out for. As a person who is usually clueless in the kitchen, I made lunch which looked good, smelled good, and tasted good. I also read the other reviews before starting, and doubled the garlic salt. Not one of the kids asked for ketchup or gravy.

This is a GREAT recipe. It is NOT over the top, very good flavor, in fact it could probably use more flavor if anything, but it is good the way it is. Stronger on the seasoning salt. I used the Cream of Chicken Soup but am anxious to try Cream of Mushroom and some garlic.
Mmmmmmm good! Turned out perfect. I don't like a lot of salt so I omitted the salt and just used season all for the paprika and garlic. It was crispy and so easy to do. Thank you

I tried this recipe tonight with chicken tenders and loved it! I upped the spices a bit as others suggested, and added some onion salt, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. The tenders needed to fry for about 6-7 minutes with oil at 375 degrees, and they were perfect. I've never been able to get a crispy crust on chicken, and have it actually stay on the chicken. This did the trick!
Very simple & good recipe chicken came out juicy on the inside & crispy on the outside. I did add 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper nice flavor will make again
Tried this recipe and it was simple and delicious . Being away from home I can appreciate simple and easy to prepare meals like this.

My family and I love this recipe. Each time I mix it up a bit and its awesome every time. To make it crunchier, add crushed corn flakes. I end up using cream of mushroom soup most of the time and it tastes just as good as if you used cream of chicken. I use chicken strip tenders in place of breasts to cut down on cutting,cooking time and mess. I also use peanut oil and it gives it more taste than using vegetable oil. I also don't use a plastic bag for the coating. Instead I use a baking dish and roll it and spoon it over it. It keeps your flour mixture from getting too chunky and moist. Very good recipe, we enjoy it at least twice a month!!

My husband wanted fried chicken for dinner tonight. The problem is I have never made fried chicken before. I found this recipe and it was a hit! The only change I made was using cream of mushroom soup since that was what I had on hand. The level of seasoning was perfect for our tastes. Definitely must let the coated chicken sit until the coating gets doughy before you fry it up, as the author suggests. Will absolutely make this again and again!

this recipe was JUST OK! THe crust was super thick and for me...maybe because i can already make great/seasoned fried chicken. The cream of chicken soup did nothing but made everything so much messier. THe key to good chicken is...buttermilk, a generous amount of garlic POWDER, onion POWDER, paprika, Season salt, salt and pepper, all purpose flour. Taste a little of your flour (just a tiny bit on your finger) and season to your preference. Honestly, to get the perfect seasoned chicken, you have to practice making your special floured batter...(do measurements and write it down)...and one day...you will have the perfect batter recipe for you.

This is the best fried chicken recipe that I have ever used and I been making fried chicken for years!!
I did add more seasonings (Mrs. Dash, Cavenders seasoning, and "shakes" of plenty of others). Thanks for a great recipe.

I always read the reviews before I try something new. I like getting the input, so I can make any adjustments I feel needed. After reading the reviews, I marinated the chicken in the soup mix for about 3hrs and I added every spice I could think of and the measurement of each spice was 1/2 tbs. I put salt,pepper,cajun,cayenne,italion,oregano,and garlic seasoning. I probably put a few others that I can't think of. I recommend adding as many spices and possible and a lot of each. Mine turned out great.

I brought this to a picnic the other day and all my friends loved it. I did read many of the reviews prior to making this so I did put extra seasoning in the coating (1/2 or 1 tsp of the following: Lawry's seasoned salt, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, Tony's creole seasoning, garlic and herb blend; plus 40 grinds of black pepper). I pretty much put seasonings in until the coating was fragrant enough for my taste. I also marinated the chicken overnight in the cream of chicken with garlic cloves, cayenne pepper, black pepper, the seasoned salt and onion powder added to it (I probably used 1/2 teaspoon of each of the dry spices). Once coated with the dry coating, I placed the chickens on my cookie rack with paper towels underneath for 45 minutes, turned them over and let sit for another 45 minutes before frying. I used boneless skinless chicken thighs and deep fried them in peanut oil for 8 minutes. Results were perfect! Chicken was juicy and flavorful and the coating had a great crunch on it.

Yes, I read the reviews before making this, and YES, I knew that most people found this chicken to be bland. Well, I obviously STILL didn't use enough spices because this chicken was incredibly boring. It's true, the chicken came out moist and the skin was nice and crispy. But we literally had to shake salt on it before EVERY bite. It concerns me that fried chicken requires SO MUCH salt in order to be palatable. I guess I will stick with broiled chicken. I should note that I used chicken that did not have any salt added before packaging. Maybe the people that "love" this recipe are using the kind that has had salt added?

Great Fried Chicken. I have been looking for a dependable recipe that provides great crispy crust, and has a great flavor. My search is over. I did not change a thing from the recipe although I did use chicken with the skin still on. This is my new standard for fried chicken.

My sister and I made this and it was delicious, moist yet crispy. I didn't have corn starch, so replaced that with a cup of crushed croutons (Fresh Gourmet Caesar croutons). This added extra flavor and crunch. We also fried it in sunflower oil which made it all the more delicious. Next time, we are going to add a little cayenne or crushed red pepper for some extra kick.

The coating that stayed on the chicken had excellent texture, though as other reviewers have noted, it was a bit on the bland side. Tossing the soup-coated chicken in a bag with the flour worked remarkably poorly - much more soup stayed in the bag than stayed on the chicken. The next time I try this recipe, I'll just mix all of the coating ingredients together and use this as a batter-fried recipe. If that doesn't work well, simply dredging the soup-coated chicken in a bowl of the flour/cornstarch mixture should work better than the bag-toss technique.

I tried this recipe for the first time tonight. I have tried unsuccessfully in the past to make a good, tasty and crispy fried chicken. This recipe is amazing! I followed the recipe like it was written; the only thing I changed due to some suggestions was I put the spices diretly in the soup marinade. I also added more spice than was suggested. I deep fried the chicken until golden brown and then put it in the oven for a few minutes just to finish it off. I paired it with ranch dressing as a dip. My husband and I both loved it and I will definitely be making this again. Thank you Candy!
This was a very easy and excellent tasting recipe. My husband loves crispy chicken and it tuned out perfect. Yes, i will be making this again soon.

Awesome... 
I have never been able to fry crunchy, tasty golden brown chicken... 
(I'd just go to KFC)...

Thank you for sharing a great recipe... Easy to make and clean up was quick.. Ingredients were easy to have on hand... Too easy

Great recipe. 
Thank you, Candy

This was really messy but fried chicken always is however you make it. It came out really tasty and crispy,and the batter stayed on good. I made it with a family pack of drumsticks in my kettle cooker (deep fryer). I will double the spices in the dry mix next time,but it's a great recipe!
great and easy to use.

I thought the chicken was fairly delicious. It had a nice crunchy crust and seasoned just right. I also seasoned my chicken with a little pepper and garlic powder, leaving out the salt since the soup will be salty enough.
might have been good if the batter wouldnt fall off.

I added a ton more spices and also put 1/2 Cup of franks red hot sauce in the wet stuff. It was awesome. Made it for my boyfriends birthday dinner, he LOVED it. We had a great time making the dinner together. clean up was easy too.
I thought this was great and reminded me of Chick fil A. I will make this one again for sure. It could use more spices though.
I haven't tried this yet, but I'm wondering if with a healthy dose of cooking spray this could be baked. Has anyone tried it?
This is wonderful way to do chicken! I added 1/2 cup of Japanese bread crumbs and ghost pepper powder to give it the kick it rightfully deserved.

Very good recipe. I like that you don't have to use buttermilk because I never have that in the house. You definitely need to let this sit after you bread it....for a half hour or hour, the longer the better. Next time I may bread it in the afternoon, put it on wax paper and put it in the fridge until I'm ready to fry it for dinner. I added more spices too....some cayenne pepper gave it a little kick =). Over all, very good, yes messy but so what! Thanks for the recipe! I forgot to add that I made it in chicken strips because I thought it would be faster. It was, but also even messier =)
